predictions.text: U.S. PCE price index (headline, seasonally adjusted) month-over-month for September 2025 will be between 0.15% and 0.30% in the BEA release on 2025-10-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: BEA Personal Income and Outlays release for September 2025 shows the PCE price index (headline) monthly percent change >= 0.15% and <= 0.30% in the published tables.
predictions.rationale: Gasoline and goods disinflation offset resilient services; recent CPI/PPI and Cleveland Fed nowcast point to a moderate PCE print.

predictions.text: ICE BofA US Corporate Index Option-Adjusted Spread (FRED: BAMLC0A0CM) will reach at or above 1.50 percentage points on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: FRED daily series BAMLC0A0CM prints a value >= 1.50 on any business day dated on or before 2025-11-30.
monitoring_signals: Primary IG issuance volume and concessions
Credit ETF spreads (LQD, HYG) vs Treasuries
ISM new orders and employment subindexes
Treasury term premium and curve shifts
predictions.rationale: Tariff uncertainty, higher term premium, and late‑cycle growth risks raise odds of modest credit spread widening.

predictions.text: The ICE U.S. Dollar Index (DXY) will close at or above 109.00 on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: An official daily close for DXY (e.g., Yahoo Finance ^DXY or equivalent) dated on or before 2025-11-30 is >= 109.00.
monitoring_signals: U.S. CPI/payrolls surprises vs euro area and Japan data
U.S. yield moves relative to G10
predictions.rationale: Tariff escalation, resilient U.S. data, and relative Euro/yen weakness favor a stronger dollar into November.

predictions.text: Amazon (AMZN) will recognize a GAAP charge of at least $2.0B related to the FTC Prime settlement in its Q3 2025 earnings release or Form 10-Q published by 2025-10-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Amazon’s Q3 2025 earnings materials (press release, shareholder letter, or Form 10‑Q) explicitly report a charge/accrual >= $2.0B attributable to the FTC Prime settlement.
predictions.rationale: Companies typically accrue settled penalties promptly; the settlement amount suggests a multi‑billion charge in Q3.

predictions.text: EIA Weekly U.S. Field Production of Crude Oil will print at or above 13.6 million barrels per day for at least one week ending by 2025-11-29, as published by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: EIA Weekly Petroleum Status Report table shows 'U.S. field production of crude oil' >= 13,600 thousand bpd for any qualifying week, with the report published on/before 2025-11-30.
monitoring_signals: U.S. oil rig counts and DUC completions
predictions.rationale: Rig productivity gains and record output trends point to new highs barring major storm disruptions.

predictions.text: The U.S. 10-Year Treasury yield (FRED: DGS10) will close at or above 4.70% on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: FRED DGS10 daily close shows a yield >= 4.70% on any observation dated on or before 2025-11-30.
monitoring_signals: Fed communications and term premium estimates
predictions.rationale: Supply risk from tariffs and sticky services inflation could push term yields higher before year‑end.

predictions.text: Euro area unemployment rate (seasonally adjusted) for September 2025 will print between 6.2% and 6.6% in Eurostat’s release due by 2025-10-31.
predictions.verification_criteria: Eurostat news release/database reports the euro area SA unemployment rate for Sep 2025 within [6.2%, 6.6%].
monitoring_signals: Member-state unemployment updates (DE, FR, IT, ES)
predictions.rationale: Euro labor market remains stable; modest slowdown keeps the rate near 6.4%.

predictions.text: From 2025-09-26 close to 2025-10-31 close, Tesla (TSLA) will underperform the Nasdaq-100 Index (^NDX) by at least 5.0 percentage points based on percentage change in adjusted close prices.
predictions.verification_criteria: Using Yahoo Finance adjusted close data, compute pct change for TSLA and ^NDX from 2025-09-26 to 2025-10-31. TSLA return must be ≤ (^NDX return − 5.0pp).
predictions.rationale: European demand softness and pricing pressure weigh on Tesla relative to megacap tech strength.

predictions.text: Copernicus ERA5 global surface air temperature for September 2025 will rank within the top 2 warmest Septembers on record in the C3S monthly bulletin released by 2025-10-07.
predictions.verification_criteria: C3S monthly climate bulletin for September 2025 states the month ranks 1st or 2nd warmest September in the ERA5 record.
predictions.rationale: Persistent ocean warmth and ongoing El Niño/neutral transition make another record‑near month likely.

predictions.text: UK Retail Sales volume (seasonally adjusted, including fuel) month-over-month for September 2025 will print between -0.6% and +0.4% in the ONS release on 2025-10-18.
predictions.verification_criteria: ONS ‘Retail sales, Great Britain’ bulletin shows the September 2025 SA total retail sales volume m/m change within [-0.6%, +0.4%].
predictions.rationale: Muted real income growth and wet weather/fuel prices suggest flat‑to‑slightly negative retail volumes.

predictions.text: China Caixin Manufacturing PMI for October 2025 will print between 50.0 and 51.5 in the release by 2025-11-01.
predictions.verification_criteria: S&P Global/Caixin press release reports October 2025 Caixin Manufacturing PMI within [50.0, 51.5].
predictions.rationale: External demand stabilization and policy support should keep the Caixin gauge modestly expansionary.

predictions.text: At its early-November 2025 meeting, the Bank of England will leave Bank Rate unchanged.
predictions.verification_criteria: The Bank of England’s Monetary Policy Summary for the November 2025 meeting states the Bank Rate is unchanged versus the previous setting.
predictions.rationale: Cooling inflation and softer growth argue for a hold while assessing prior tightening.
